abstracts.cdata!:
The Ninth Power Project is a four-year
            slice of Ceylon Electricity Board's distribution
            rehabilitation and expansion program.  It seeks to improve
            the reliability and quality of power supply, reduce losses
            to more reasonable levels, and expand the distribution
            system to meet forecast demand for electricity.  Project
            components comprise the erection of about 950 km of 33-kV
            lines, extension and rehabilitation of low-voltage
            distribution networks, and technical assistance.
